posts.title: US transportation secretary changed wife’s flight from Newark after insisting airport was safe
top_comments: These people are as comically evil as they are incompetent. You can't trust a single thing they say.
As a Wisconsinite, I’m truly sorry the rest of the country has to deal with this fool now.

I clicked this expecting to see that an intrepid journalist did some deep investigation to find proof of the flight change.

But no, this idiot just went on a radio show and announced it.
Lmao so he blinked. Got it. I mean they truly think that the general populace is stupid if they think that we are focusing on what they're saying versus what they're doing. Incompetent morons.
If the Dems were this incompetent you'd hear about it everywhere 24/7.

When someone says information is power, the United States from 2010-2025 is a prime example. 

Our information ecosystems are fundamentally divergent. Thus tens of millions of people get different I information, news, facts, truths, etc than tens of millions of others. 

That is the ONLY way you achieve what this nation has in the past decade. 

Thirty years ago, Trump would have been laughed out of the 2015 primaries. 

But after 30+ years (starting in the 1990s) of partisan based escalating Culture War for profit, by the time the “age of information” took hold half the country was just ready and waiting for an anti-lib media ecosystem. 

They had Rush and Fox News and in the days before the World Wide Web was truly ubiquitous that was more than enough to make billions off culture war. But it wasn’t enough to truly alter/diverge realities. The way information traveled was still “slow”. Outlets, regardless of lean were all still covering the same basic news stories. Average Americans may have had bias one way or the other, but they still all got more or less the same basic information from which to understand the world. 

But that stopped being true once the flood gates of digital media opened, and they technology of targeted advertising became the number one business model in the digital age. 

The barrier of entry was lowered so much that millions could start a blog, a community, or a “new media” company. Better yet, there are nearly no rules to how you create and spread information online. Your voice, for free, can carry equal weight to a press outlet that has to pay researchers, editors, reporters, fact checkers, and journalists. Your voice can EARN as much as outlets that  have basic news gathering and reporting standards and practices. 

There was never a version of this world where real news gathering/reporting and real journalism were ever going to survive in the face of millions of people who can just blast their opinions and hot takes. Especially when ad sales platforms do not care what those opinions and hot takes are. Especially when millions of people don’t care if what they say is accurate, true, or even in good faith. 

And all of the above is BEFORE social media, with its engagement and personalization algos, and it’s built in incentives to create and spread as much content as possible. 

WE

ARE

BROKEN
Safe for me, but not for thee! Some of you may die, but that is a sacrifice I am willing to make.
To be fair, you should avoid Newark Airport mostly because of the delays this clown is responsible for, not the safety risk.
He's a Republican, would you allow your ***valuable property*** to travel through a dangerous airport???
Okay, but what about her emails?

posts.title: More than 1,000 Starbucks baristas go on strike to protest new dress code
top_comments:
**Summary:**

Over 1,000 Starbucks baristas at 75 U.S. stores have gone on strike since Sunday to protest a new dress code requiring solid black shirts and khaki, black, or blue denim bottoms.

Previously, employees could wear more varied dark colors and patterns. 

Starbucks says the change is meant to make its green apron more distinctive and create a more welcoming atmosphere.

However, Starbucks Workers United, the union representing employees at 570 company-owned stores, argues that the policy should be negotiated as part of collective bargaining.

Workers also criticized the company for selling now-banned clothing styles on its internal site.

Starbucks stated the strike has had minimal impact and criticized the union for not prioritizing contract negotiations.

The union has filed a complaint with the National Labor Relations Board.
I don’t think I’ve ever noticed what a barista was wearing aside from if they had an apron on or a hat of some sort.
Is it really about the dress code? Or was this just the last straw in a line of other grievances?
Hate when I try to order a coffee but none of the workers clothing makes their aprons color pop and I don't feel welcome and have to have a screaming mental breakdown

>create a sense of familiarity for customers as it tries to establish a warmer, more welcoming feeling in its stores.

I don't think that having every store and every person working there looking the same accomplishes this.
I can't believe someone out there is being paid 90 million a year to think up stupid shit like this
They don't even want people drinking their drinks in the store anymore. Why the fuck should customers care how "inviting" baristas look? Starbucks corporate wants us out of their stores.

It's very simple: whatever your opinion is on the dress code and it's validity, the union is arguing that the company doesn't have the right to change the dress code without prior consent from the union.


This is simply a case of the union looking out for workers the way it's supposed to, and it wouldn't matter if the dress code was changed to clown shoes and a clown car or to outlaw the color the Puce. The union is arguing that they need to be consulted and negotiated with no matter what the change is.


They are not dying on the hill of the dress code. They are dying on the hill of the rights of the union to collective bargaining.

The less a job pays, the more controlling it is.

Working a shit job on your feet for 8-12 hours a day for minimum wage? No sitting, don't you dare be late to and from your 15 minute break, don't you dare have a snack on the job, restroom breaks better not be more than 2-3 minutes, but also don't you DARE clock in or out a minute later or earlier than you're supposed to. But you better be available whenever they call, god help you if you aren't. 

And of course, the good ol' American tradition of as few days off as they're legally allowed to give you, all the way down to zero. Also don't forget some of that pay is going back into your own healthcare THAT YOU STILL HAVE TO PAY MONEY FOR if something goes wrong.

A lot of people siding with the a union busting company flagrantly ignoring mandatory bargaining when the terms and conditions of employment have being changed.

Yeah, ultimately a dress code may or may not be a small thing.  
So crazy that the company is violating NLRA to do so when they could have just... bargained with the union.

Lots of people probably think it's the customer's fault for the "Warning: Coffee May Be Hot" stuff.

Starbucks knows exactly what they're doing: Undermining the union they wish would just go away already.

>On Monday, the boy told his grandmother he was "going to be famous" before being picked up by his mom and taken to school, according to officials.

> The explosive device had the words "For Brenton Tarrant," referencing the shooter in the 2019 mosque attack, along with multiple "SS" symbols and "14 words" -- referencing white supremacy -- written on it, according to the affidavit.

How does a middle-schooler become so radicalized?  The internet is turning out to be as much a curse as a blessing.  Free speech never ran up against something as powerful as social media, we have to figure this out.
Thank God for that grandmother. She potentially saved many lives. And shame on that mother. What a stupid stupid lady.

Damn. If the report here is accurate, this wasn't simply a case of an inattentive or incompetent parent, this was essentially grooming him to become a mass shooter. It wouldn't surprise me if it comes out she flat out instructed him to do it.

So the kid is a Texican white supremacist? The mom too?

The key thing was that this kid was idolizing a neonazi mass murderer:

>On Monday, the boy told his grandmother he was "going to be famous" before being picked up by his mom and taken to school, according to officials.

>The grandmother then looked through the boy's bedroom, where she found magazines loaded with live rifle ammunition and pistol magazines loaded with live ammunition, the affidavit said.

>She also found an "improvised explosive device" -- a mortar-style firework wrapped in duct tape -- among the boy's belongings, the affidavit noted. The explosive device had the words "For Brenton Tarrant," referencing the shooter in the 2019 mosque attack, along with multiple "SS" symbols and "14 words" -- referencing white supremacy -- written on it, according to the affidavit.

>Along with the weaponry, the grandmother found a handwritten note referring to previous mass shootings, mass shooting suspects and the number of victims in each incident, the affidavit said.

Just another moron brainwashed on White supremacy on the internet, while actually being a minority. 🤦

When tf are we going to do something about this nazi/White supremacist garbage that keeps on spreading like a disease on the internet?
And they say parents aren't involved in their kids educations these days.

posts.title: 18-year-old girl escapes captivity from New Jersey home where she was allegedly forced to live in dog crate and abused
top_comments:
>A New Jersey couple has been charged after an 18-year-old escaped their residence and said she was forced to live in a dog crate for a year, given a bucket to use as a bathroom and sexually abused.

>Brenda Spencer, 38, and Branndon Mosley, 41, of Gloucester Township, were charged with kidnapping and Mosley with additional counts of sexual assault, The Camden County Prosecutor’s Office and Gloucester Township Police announced Wednesday. 

>The 18-year-old female had escaped the home on May 8, assisted by a neighbor, prosecutors and police said in a [news release.](https://camdencountypros.org/news/article/2236?fbclid=IwY2xjawKRp_9leHRuA2FlbQIxMABicmlkETFCY3MzQWJNSDJMSFlrOVNnAR4GzMVmBE9KiKriuG3mfkneWSdhLhN9kX6JEAHEGSzpvMUKbpV3oi2ZlPEk1Q_aem_LxPQvRGtmwszP5CpKS2Hwg) The abuse was then reported to police on Saturday.

>The victim said Spencer and Mosley had abused her since 2018.

>Around that time, she was removed from school when she was in the sixth grade “at Spencer’s discretion and confined to her home,” officials said. The victim said shortly after she was pulled out of school, she was “forced to live in a dog crate for approximately one year and was let out periodically,” the release said. 

>Later, she was forced to live in a padlocked bathroom and was chained up. She told police she would be let out of the bathroom when family visited the home. At other times she lived in a bare room with a bucket to use as a toilet.

>The victim told police the room had an alarm system that would “alert Spencer and Mosley if she tried to leave.” The victim also reported being beaten with a belt and sexually abused by Mosley, officials stated.

It's a horrific story, with more details including a 13-year-old who also lived there as well as the kids being pulled out of school years before. How this couple (assuming they are parents but it doesn't specifically say so) could do that do another human being is unfathomable. The law better come down hard on them, with them never seeing the outside of a prison ever again.

This whole “kids were removed from school by parents discretion” thing is one of the things that makes me so uneasy about homeschooling. I know this isn’t that, but the idea that a parent can lock a child away from the world is terrifying.

What the absolute fuck.

I hope the two girls are getting the help they need. Put the monsters where monsters belong.
It’s horrible what people do to kids

Ah jeez they live next to my old neighborhood. It's right near an elementary school. There needs to be regular welfare checks for home schooled children in an effort to prevent horrible shit like this from happening.
Yeah, if someone gets homeschooled there should be regular wellness checks

This is horrific. 

The couple should get a life sentence with forced physical labor. All their earnings should go to the girl.

I don't get why there aren't semi annual home inspections and  private interviews for home schooled kids.

Is it really this easy to let them slip under the radar?
So El Salvador for these folks? Were they not saying for the worst of the worst even if you are American.
There are some absolute garbage people in this world, hope those girls can get help and try to live a life they deserve

Today was not a good day to be able to read.

There is true evil in the world. I hope those girls get the help they need.

posts.title: Minneapolis and state leaders prepare for possible Derek Chauvin pardon
top_comments: Article says that even if he's pardoned for his Federal crimes, he must still serve his sentences for his state crimes. 22 years. He's not going to be set free.

From the article:

> Multiple sources told 5 EYEWITNESS NEWS that Gov. Tim Walz, the Minnesota National Guard, Mayor Jacob Frey and Hennepin County Sheriff Dawanna Witt have all been briefed on preparations for possible civil unrest if President Donald Trump pardons former Minneapolis Police Officer Derek Chauvin for his federal conviction of killing George Floyd.

> Then, on Monday, when asked about the possibility of a pardon, Gov. Walz told reporters, “No indication whether they’re going to do it, or not, but I think it behooves us to be prepared for it. With this presidency, it seems like something they would do.”

So it doesn't sound like Trump or the White House have said anything concrete, but there seem to be *rumors* circulating of a potential pardon which is what is causing this preparation.

The good news: Trump can only pardon him on federal crimes, not the state ones. Chauvin still has a 22 year sentence to serve in Minnesota even if he is pardoned federally.
Trump absolutely will pardon him, but he owes Minnesota 22 additional years.
Can’t be pardoned by Trump for his state convictions which carry a longer sentence.
If they ignore the states 22 year sentence even if pardoned you’re setting a scary precedent
Trump is trying to get black people to start mass protesting so he can declare a national emergency and fuck shit up forever.
This seems like Trump trying to let a federal pardon also pardon a state crime.  Try it on Chauvin and see if it works before he does it to himself and friends.

They’re doing this to get black folk out to protest to lock us up and send us out of the country. 

I pray we don’t fall for it.
The irony is that Chauvin is probably safer and more comfortable in federal prison than he would be in state prison. Trump wouldn’t be doing him any favors.
They want to poke the BLM bear into rioting so they can deploy the military.

posts.title: Oklahoma education standards say students must identify 2020 election 'discrepancies'
top_comments: Honestly, as a teacher I would take this and use it to start teaching about all the discrepancies involving misinformation surrounding the election.
Oklahomans weren't satisfied being ranked 49th in Education. They really want that coveted 50th spot.
But I bet you can’t teach them the accurate and comprehensive history about slavery, Jim Crow laws, the KKK, the Civil Rights movement..
And for World History they want students to identify what went right in 1933 German politics...
Remember when MAGA called education indoctrination? Maybe they were right
If you can’t win history, rewrite it. Right comrads?

"TULSA, Okla. — New academic standards in Oklahoma call for the teaching of "discrepancies" in the 2020 election results, continuing the spread of a false narrative years after it was first pushed by President Trump and his allies."

"The standards were enacted last month after the Republican-controlled Legislature declined to block them. And while the process to advance the standards has drawn ire from members of Oklahoma's majority party, the question of the standards' content has gotten little pushback."

"The new standards have been championed by Ryan Walters, the state superintendent of public instruction and a conservative firebrand."

#  "These new standards will ensure that kids have an accurate and comprehensive view of historical events, while also reinforcing the values that make our country great," Walters said at a February State Board of Education meeting.

"The new standards were [quietly introduced just hours before that February meeting](https://www.kgou.org/education/2025-04-24/oklahoma-board-of-ed-pushes-back-on-social-studies-standards-senate-gop-poised-to-reject-them), and Walters falsely told board members that to make legislative deadlines, the standards needed to be approved that day. They were."

"While the standards are set to go into effect next school year, a lawsuit filed by a GOP former Oklahoma attorney general could stall their implementation."

"But like other criticisms coming from Republicans, the lawsuit calls out problems in the approval process — not the standards themselves."
Why on earth would anyone live there if they had any other option?
You mean the discrepancies that resulted in the people claiming they existed losing a bunch of lawsuits because they had zero evidence to back up their claims? Those discrepancies?

While shielding them from the truth that the Conservative Supreme Court was presented with these supposed “discrepencies” and they refused to even hear the case, citing lack of evidence… 

That fact blows up any and all claims of a stolen election. If there was a shred of viable evidence that Dems stole the election, the supreme court would have tripped over themselves to hear the case. 

Trump lost. Anyone saying anything else is lying to push a political agenda.

posts.title: Yemeni terror suspect placed under house arrest at Toronto mosque
More than 1,000 Starbucks baristas go on strike to protest new dress code
top_comments:
**Summary:**

Over 1,000 Starbucks baristas at 75 U.S. stores have gone on strike since Sunday to protest a new dress code requiring solid black shirts and khaki, black, or blue denim bottoms.

Previously, employees could wear more varied dark colors and patterns. 

Starbucks says the change is meant to make its green apron more distinctive and create a more welcoming atmosphere.

However, Starbucks Workers United, the union representing employees at 570 company-owned stores, argues that the policy should be negotiated as part of collective bargaining.

Workers also criticized the company for selling now-banned clothing styles on its internal site.

Starbucks stated the strike has had minimal impact and criticized the union for not prioritizing contract negotiations.

The union has filed a complaint with the National Labor Relations Board.
I don’t think I’ve ever noticed what a barista was wearing aside from if they had an apron on or a hat of some sort.
Is it really about the dress code? Or was this just the last straw in a line of other grievances?
Hate when I try to order a coffee but none of the workers clothing makes their aprons color pop and I don't feel welcome and have to have a screaming mental breakdown

>create a sense of familiarity for customers as it tries to establish a warmer, more welcoming feeling in its stores.

I don't think that having every store and every person working there looking the same accomplishes this.
I can't believe someone out there is being paid 90 million a year to think up stupid shit like this
They don't even want people drinking their drinks in the store anymore. Why the fuck should customers care how "inviting" baristas look? Starbucks corporate wants us out of their stores.

It's very simple: whatever your opinion is on the dress code and it's validity, the union is arguing that the company doesn't have the right to change the dress code without prior consent from the union.


This is simply a case of the union looking out for workers the way it's supposed to, and it wouldn't matter if the dress code was changed to clown shoes and a clown car or to outlaw the color the Puce. The union is arguing that they need to be consulted and negotiated with no matter what the change is.


They are not dying on the hill of the dress code. They are dying on the hill of the rights of the union to collective bargaining.

The less a job pays, the more controlling it is.

Working a shit job on your feet for 8-12 hours a day for minimum wage? No sitting, don't you dare be late to and from your 15 minute break, don't you dare have a snack on the job, restroom breaks better not be more than 2-3 minutes, but also don't you DARE clock in or out a minute later or earlier than you're supposed to. But you better be available whenever they call, god help you if you aren't. 

And of course, the good ol' American tradition of as few days off as they're legally allowed to give you, all the way down to zero. Also don't forget some of that pay is going back into your own healthcare THAT YOU STILL HAVE TO PAY MONEY FOR if something goes wrong.

A lot of people siding with the a union busting company flagrantly ignoring mandatory bargaining when the terms and conditions of employment have being changed.

Yeah, ultimately a dress code may or may not be a small thing.  
So crazy that the company is violating NLRA to do so when they could have just... bargained with the union.

Lots of people probably think it's the customer's fault for the "Warning: Coffee May Be Hot" stuff.

Starbucks knows exactly what they're doing: Undermining the union they wish would just go away already.

posts.title: Minneapolis and state leaders prepare for possible Derek Chauvin pardon
top_comments: Article says that even if he's pardoned for his Federal crimes, he must still serve his sentences for his state crimes. 22 years. He's not going to be set free.

From the article:

> Multiple sources told 5 EYEWITNESS NEWS that Gov. Tim Walz, the Minnesota National Guard, Mayor Jacob Frey and Hennepin County Sheriff Dawanna Witt have all been briefed on preparations for possible civil unrest if President Donald Trump pardons former Minneapolis Police Officer Derek Chauvin for his federal conviction of killing George Floyd.

> Then, on Monday, when asked about the possibility of a pardon, Gov. Walz told reporters, “No indication whether they’re going to do it, or not, but I think it behooves us to be prepared for it. With this presidency, it seems like something they would do.”

So it doesn't sound like Trump or the White House have said anything concrete, but there seem to be *rumors* circulating of a potential pardon which is what is causing this preparation.

The good news: Trump can only pardon him on federal crimes, not the state ones. Chauvin still has a 22 year sentence to serve in Minnesota even if he is pardoned federally.
Trump absolutely will pardon him, but he owes Minnesota 22 additional years.
Can’t be pardoned by Trump for his state convictions which carry a longer sentence.
If they ignore the states 22 year sentence even if pardoned you’re setting a scary precedent
Trump is trying to get black people to start mass protesting so he can declare a national emergency and fuck shit up forever.
This seems like Trump trying to let a federal pardon also pardon a state crime.  Try it on Chauvin and see if it works before he does it to himself and friends.

They’re doing this to get black folk out to protest to lock us up and send us out of the country. 

I pray we don’t fall for it.
The irony is that Chauvin is probably safer and more comfortable in federal prison than he would be in state prison. Trump wouldn’t be doing him any favors.
They want to poke the BLM bear into rioting so they can deploy the military.

posts.title: More than 1,000 Starbucks baristas go on strike to protest new dress code
top_comments:
**Summary:**

Over 1,000 Starbucks baristas at 75 U.S. stores have gone on strike since Sunday to protest a new dress code requiring solid black shirts and khaki, black, or blue denim bottoms.

Previously, employees could wear more varied dark colors and patterns. 

Starbucks says the change is meant to make its green apron more distinctive and create a more welcoming atmosphere.

However, Starbucks Workers United, the union representing employees at 570 company-owned stores, argues that the policy should be negotiated as part of collective bargaining.

Workers also criticized the company for selling now-banned clothing styles on its internal site.

Starbucks stated the strike has had minimal impact and criticized the union for not prioritizing contract negotiations.

The union has filed a complaint with the National Labor Relations Board.
I don’t think I’ve ever noticed what a barista was wearing aside from if they had an apron on or a hat of some sort.
Is it really about the dress code? Or was this just the last straw in a line of other grievances?
Hate when I try to order a coffee but none of the workers clothing makes their aprons color pop and I don't feel welcome and have to have a screaming mental breakdown

>create a sense of familiarity for customers as it tries to establish a warmer, more welcoming feeling in its stores.

I don't think that having every store and every person working there looking the same accomplishes this.
I can't believe someone out there is being paid 90 million a year to think up stupid shit like this
They don't even want people drinking their drinks in the store anymore. Why the fuck should customers care how "inviting" baristas look? Starbucks corporate wants us out of their stores.

It's very simple: whatever your opinion is on the dress code and it's validity, the union is arguing that the company doesn't have the right to change the dress code without prior consent from the union.


This is simply a case of the union looking out for workers the way it's supposed to, and it wouldn't matter if the dress code was changed to clown shoes and a clown car or to outlaw the color the Puce. The union is arguing that they need to be consulted and negotiated with no matter what the change is.


They are not dying on the hill of the dress code. They are dying on the hill of the rights of the union to collective bargaining.

The less a job pays, the more controlling it is.

Working a shit job on your feet for 8-12 hours a day for minimum wage? No sitting, don't you dare be late to and from your 15 minute break, don't you dare have a snack on the job, restroom breaks better not be more than 2-3 minutes, but also don't you DARE clock in or out a minute later or earlier than you're supposed to. But you better be available whenever they call, god help you if you aren't. 

And of course, the good ol' American tradition of as few days off as they're legally allowed to give you, all the way down to zero. Also don't forget some of that pay is going back into your own healthcare THAT YOU STILL HAVE TO PAY MONEY FOR if something goes wrong.

A lot of people siding with the a union busting company flagrantly ignoring mandatory bargaining when the terms and conditions of employment have being changed.

Yeah, ultimately a dress code may or may not be a small thing.  
So crazy that the company is violating NLRA to do so when they could have just... bargained with the union.

Lots of people probably think it's the customer's fault for the "Warning: Coffee May Be Hot" stuff.

Starbucks knows exactly what they're doing: Undermining the union they wish would just go away already.

Oh, the irony

A roller coaster ride of a read.

What a misleading band name.

If there was ever a time for quotation marks…
Ok so in a way Truck Hits Venue sounds like a band that went on first and slayed so hard they cancelled the next band, Boy Hits Car. XD props to the journalist, once in a lifetime headline lmao

posts.title: 18-year-old girl escapes captivity from New Jersey home where she was allegedly forced to live in dog crate and abused
top_comments:
>A New Jersey couple has been charged after an 18-year-old escaped their residence and said she was forced to live in a dog crate for a year, given a bucket to use as a bathroom and sexually abused.

>Brenda Spencer, 38, and Branndon Mosley, 41, of Gloucester Township, were charged with kidnapping and Mosley with additional counts of sexual assault, The Camden County Prosecutor’s Office and Gloucester Township Police announced Wednesday. 

>The 18-year-old female had escaped the home on May 8, assisted by a neighbor, prosecutors and police said in a [news release.](https://camdencountypros.org/news/article/2236?fbclid=IwY2xjawKRp_9leHRuA2FlbQIxMABicmlkETFCY3MzQWJNSDJMSFlrOVNnAR4GzMVmBE9KiKriuG3mfkneWSdhLhN9kX6JEAHEGSzpvMUKbpV3oi2ZlPEk1Q_aem_LxPQvRGtmwszP5CpKS2Hwg) The abuse was then reported to police on Saturday.

>The victim said Spencer and Mosley had abused her since 2018.

>Around that time, she was removed from school when she was in the sixth grade “at Spencer’s discretion and confined to her home,” officials said. The victim said shortly after she was pulled out of school, she was “forced to live in a dog crate for approximately one year and was let out periodically,” the release said. 

>Later, she was forced to live in a padlocked bathroom and was chained up. She told police she would be let out of the bathroom when family visited the home. At other times she lived in a bare room with a bucket to use as a toilet.

>The victim told police the room had an alarm system that would “alert Spencer and Mosley if she tried to leave.” The victim also reported being beaten with a belt and sexually abused by Mosley, officials stated.

It's a horrific story, with more details including a 13-year-old who also lived there as well as the kids being pulled out of school years before. How this couple (assuming they are parents but it doesn't specifically say so) could do that do another human being is unfathomable. The law better come down hard on them, with them never seeing the outside of a prison ever again.

This whole “kids were removed from school by parents discretion” thing is one of the things that makes me so uneasy about homeschooling. I know this isn’t that, but the idea that a parent can lock a child away from the world is terrifying.

What the absolute fuck.

I hope the two girls are getting the help they need. Put the monsters where monsters belong.
It’s horrible what people do to kids

Ah jeez they live next to my old neighborhood. It's right near an elementary school. There needs to be regular welfare checks for home schooled children in an effort to prevent horrible shit like this from happening.
Yeah, if someone gets homeschooled there should be regular wellness checks

This is horrific. 

The couple should get a life sentence with forced physical labor. All their earnings should go to the girl.

I don't get why there aren't semi annual home inspections and  private interviews for home schooled kids.

Is it really this easy to let them slip under the radar?
So El Salvador for these folks? Were they not saying for the worst of the worst even if you are American.
There are some absolute garbage people in this world, hope those girls can get help and try to live a life they deserve

Today was not a good day to be able to read.

There is true evil in the world. I hope those girls get the help they need.
